verses.verse: A Psalm of David. Strive<WH3401> thou<WH3068>, O Jehovah, with them that strive<WH3401> with me<WH3898>: Fight thou against them that fight against me<WH3898>.
Take hold<WH2388> of shield<WH4043> and buckler<WH6793>, And stand up<WH6965> for my help<WH5833>.
Draw out<WH7324> also the spear<WH2595>, and stop<WH5462> the way against<WH7125> them that pursue<WH7291> me<WH559>: Say unto my soul<WH5315>, I am thy salvation<WH3444>.

Let them be put to shame<WH954> and brought to dishonor<WH3637> that seek<WH1245> after my soul<WH5315>: Let them be turned<WH5472> back<WH268> and confounded<WH2659> that devise<WH2803> my hurt<WH7451>.
Let them be as chaff<WH4671> before<WH6440> the wind<WH7307>, And the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068> driving them on<WH1760>.
Let their way<WH1870> be dark<WH2822> and slippery<WH2519>, And the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068> pursuing them<WH7291>.
For without cause<WH2600> have they hid<WH2934> for me their net<WH7568> in a pit<WH7845>; Without cause<WH2600> have they digged<WH2658> a pit for my soul<WH5315>.
Let destruction<WH7722> come<WH935> upon him unawares<WH3045>; And let his net<WH7568> that he hath hid<WH2934> catch<WH3920> himself<WH7722>: With destruction let him fall therein<WH5307>.
And my soul<WH5315> shall be joyful<WH1523> in Jehovah<WH3068>: It shall rejoice<WH7797> in his salvation<WH3444>.

All my bones<WH6106> shall say<WH559>, Jehovah<WH3068>, who is like unto thee<WH5337>, Who deliverest the poor<WH6041> from him that is too strong<WH2389> for him<WH6041>, Yea, the poor and the needy<WH34> from him that robbeth him<WH1497>?
Unrighteous <WH2555> witnesses<WH5707> rise up<WH6965>; They ask me of things<WH7592> that I know not<WH3045>.
They reward<WH7999> me evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896>, To the bereaving<WH7908> of my soul<WH5315>.

But as for me<WH2470>, when they were sick, my clothing<WH3830> was sackcloth<WH8242>: I afflicted<WH6031> my soul<WH5315> with fasting<WH6685>; And my prayer<WH8605> returned<WH7725> into mine own bosom<WH2436>.
I behaved<WH1980> myself as though it had been my friend<WH7453> or my brother<WH251>: I bowed down<WH7817> mourning<WH6937>, as one that bewaileth<WH57> his mother<WH517>.

But in mine adversity<WH6761> they rejoiced<WH8055>, and gathered themselves together<WH622>: The abjects<WH5222> gathered themselves together<WH622> against me<WH3045>, and I knew it not<WH7167>; They did tear me<WH1826>, and ceased not:
Like the profane<WH2611> mockers<WH3934> in feasts<WH4580>, They gnashed<WH2786> upon me with their teeth<WH8127>.
Lord <WH136>, how long wilt thou look on<WH7200>? Rescue<WH7725> my soul<WH5315> from their destructions<WH7722>, My darling<WH3173> from the lions<WH3715>.
I will give thee thanks<WH3034> in the great<WH7227> assembly<WH6951>: I will praise<WH1984> thee among much<WH6099> people<WH5971>.
Let not them that are mine enemies<WH341> wrongfully<WH8267> rejoice<WH8055> over me<WH7169>; Neither let them wink with the eye<WH5869> that hate<WH8130> me without a cause<WH2600>.
For they speak<WH1696> not peace<WH7965>; But they devise<WH2803> deceitful<WH4820> words<WH1697> against them that are quiet<WH7282> in the land<WH776>.
Yea <WH6310>, they opened their mouth wide<WH7337> against me<WH559>; They said, Aha<WH1889>, aha<WH1889>, our eye<WH5869> hath seen it<WH7200>.
Thou hast seen<WH7200> it<WH3068>, O Jehovah; Keep not silence<WH2790>: O Lord<WH136>, be not far from me<WH7368>.
Stir up<WH5782> thyself<WH6974>, and awake to the justice<WH4941> due unto me<WH7379>, Even unto my cause, my God<WH430> and my Lord<WH136>.
Judge <WH8199> me<WH3068>, O Jehovah my God<WH430>, according to thy righteousness<WH6664>; And let them not rejoice over me<WH8055>.
Let them not say<WH559> in their heart<WH3820>, Aha<WH1889>, so would we have it<WH5315>: Let them not say<WH559>, We have swallowed him up<WH1104>.

Let them be put to shame<WH954> and confounded<WH954> together<WH3162> that rejoice<WH8056> at my hurt<WH7451>: Let them be clothed<WH3847> with shame<WH1322> and dishonor<WH3639> that magnify themselves against me<WH1431>.

Let them shout for joy<WH7442>, and be glad<WH8055>, that favor<WH2655> my righteous cause<WH6664>: Yea<WH559>, let them say continually<WH8548>, Jehovah<WH3068> be magnified<WH1431>, Who hath pleasure<WH2655> in the prosperity<WH7965> of his servant<WH5650>.
And my tongue<WH3956> shall talk<WH1897> of thy righteousness<WH6664> And of thy praise<WH8416> all the day long<WH3117>.
